briefdescription.para: Calculates the mathmatical constant pi.

detaileddescription.para: Pi is the ratio of a circle's circumfernce to it's diameter, always coming out to equal roughly 3.14, no matter the size of the circle.

It is located here as a long double to have the most possible digits.
Pi

briefdescription.para: Calculates the mathmatical constant tau.

detaileddescription.para:
Tau is known as 2pi and represents the full turn of a circle. It also represents 6.28 radians, a full circle, equal to 360 degrees.
Tau
toRadians()

briefdescription.para: Calculates the mathmatical constant represented by gamma, or the `Euler–Mascheroni constant.

detaileddescription.para: Gamma is used in number theory and analysis. @return TheEuler–Mascheroni constant`

briefdescription.para: Calculates the mathmatical constant known as Eulers Number, or e.
Calculates the square root of 2, also known as the principal square root of 2.

detaileddescription.para:
This number when multiplied by itself returns 2. It is used in trigonometry.
Square root of 2

briefdescription.para: Calculates the square root of 3, also known as the principal square root of 3.

detaileddescription.para:
This number when multiplied by itself returns 3. It is used in geometery and trigonometry.
Square root of 3

briefdescription.para: Calculates the square root of 5, also known as the principal square root of 5.

detaileddescription.para:
This number when multiplied by itself returns 5. It is used in geometery and trigonometry.
Square root of 5

briefdescription.para: Calculates the golden ratio, also represented by phi.

detaileddescription.para: The golden ratio is referenced throughout many different parts of mathmatics, including geometery, trigonometry, pyramids, the fibonacci sequence, and algebra.

briefdescription.para: Gets the absolute value of a number.

detaileddescription.para:
The absolute value is the unsigned version of a number.
value
Number that is either negative or positive
|value|

briefdescription.para: Verifies whether a number is prime.

detaileddescription.para:
A prime number is one that's only factors are one and itself.
value
Number to check if prime
true if the number is prime, false otherwise

briefdescription.para: Checks if a number is even.

detaileddescription.para:
An even number is one that is divisable by 2.
value
Number to check if even
true if the value is divisable by 2, false otherwise
isOdd(const int)

briefdescription.para: Checks if a number is odd.

detaileddescription.para:
An odd number is one that is not divisable by 2.
value
Number to check if odd
true if the value is not divisable by 2, false otherwise
isEven(const int)

Squaring a number equals a number times iteslf.

detaileddescription.para:
Cubing a number is equal to itself to the power of 3.
value
Number to cube
value^3 or value*value*value

simplesect.para: The same number represented as radians

briefdescription.para: Conversion of radians to degrees.

parameterdescription.para: An angle in radians

simplesect.para: The same number represented as degrees

briefdescription.para: Inverses a N by N Matrix.

detaileddescription.para: An inversed Matrix times a normal Matrix equals the identity Matrix
Not to be confused with tr()
If T is not a floating point type, the output may not work, as it will round.

The output is calculated via the Caley-Hamilton theorum (https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Cayley%E2%80%93Hamilton_theorem)
matrix
The Matrix to invert
The inverse of matrix
T
Type of the Matrix
N
Order of the Matrix
The size of the Matrix must be greater than 1 Bug
Matrices bigger then 2x2 dont work

briefdescription.para: Transposes a Matrix.

detaileddescription.para:
Transposing a Matrix creates a reflection of it, where every row is a column.
matrix
What to transpose
A reflected matrix
T
Type of the Matrix
W
Width of the Matrix
H
Height of the Matrix

Size of the Matrix

briefdescription.para: Calculates the trace of a Matrix.

detaileddescription.para: The trace is the sum of all of the diagonal elements of a Matrix.
The trace is related to the derivative of a determinate.

Not to be confused with transpose(const Matrix&))
m
Matrix to calculate the trace of
The sum of the diagonal elements of m
T
Type of the Matrix
N
Size of the Matrix
inverse(const Matrix<T,N,N>&)

memberdef.argsstring: (const float FOV, const float NEAR_PLANE, const float FAR_PLANE, const float aspectRatio)
memberdef.name: projection

briefdescription.para: Generates a projection matrix based on values.

detaileddescription.para: Each time the window changes size, you need to regenerate your projection matrix

Projection matrices are used in 3D graphics. Vectors multiplied by a projection matrix are transformed to "look" 3-dimensional.
FOV
The field of vision, in degrees
NEAR_PLANE
A float representing the near clipping plane. Z values lower than this are not visible to the viewer
FAR_PLANE
A float representing the far clipping plane. Z values higher than this are not visible to the viewer
aspectRatio
The aspect ratio of the screen.
A projection matrix made from the specified settings
ortho(const float, const float, const float, const float, const float)

memberdef.argsstring: (const float left, const float right, const float bottom, const float top, const float near, const float far)
memberdef.name: ortho

briefdescription.para: Generates an orthographic projection matrix.

detaileddescription.para:
As opposed to a standard projection matrix, vectors in an orthographic projection don't become smaller the farther away they are. When combined with a rotational matrix, it can create an isometric view, which is used extensively in games like Simcity. Isometric views are also used heavily in 3D modeling software to represent the dimensions of an object.In a 2D environment, an orthographic projection matrix can be used to scale the screen.
left
The left plane of the orthographic projection
right
The right plane of the orthographic projection
bottom
The bottom plane of the orthographic projection
top
The top plane of the orthographic projection
near
The near plane of the orthographic projection
far
The far plane of the orthographic projection
An ortographic projection matrix generated from the values.
projection(const float, const float, const float, const float)
